Description: Ostracon, fragment of the rim and body of a red pottery wheel-made bowl, convex and slightly grooved sides with an everted ledge-rim, with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior and a further two lines on the interior, both now very faded, and containing an order for payment.
Curator's comments: From Papnoute, the writer of O.Sarga 98, 177, 178 and probably of 114, and recipient of O.Sarga 95, 97 and perhaps 92, 186, 187.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.145-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87661) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87661)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 181 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
